According to RFC 4918, MKCOL takes no body. However, RFC 568920 allows a body, which must be a single mkcol element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!-- MKCOL method, optional XML body, exactly one mkcol -->

  2. <!ELEMENT mkcol (set+)>

  3.    <!ELEMENT set (prop) >

  4.       <!ELEMENT prop ANY >

  5.         <!-- children must be tags with valid XML values -->

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. mkcol

<unless method requires no body or XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_MKCOL

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_MKCOL:

  2.   /* exactly one child element called propertyupdate, with at least one child */

  3.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  4.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_MKCOL || !xml_child(node) ||

  5.      !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  6.     valid = FALSE;

  7.   for(node = node->children; node && valid; node = node->next) {

  8.     xmlNodePtr c;

  9.     /* one or more set nodes */

  10.     /* with a single prop child whose children are property tags */

  11.     valid = node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE && (c = xml_child(node)) &&

  12.             !c->next && c->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  13.             check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) && check_ns(c, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  14.             xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_SET && xml_tag(c) == XML_NAME_PROP &&

  15.             check_prop(c, TRUE);

  16.   }

  17.   break;

The REPORT method requires an XML body, but allows any single root tag as its body content. Several RFCs define bodies, though. Unfortunately, one of those defines a different namespace (urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:caldav), as well, so this can't be a simple switch after checking for the usual DAV: namespace. Any report types not covered by known RFCs must be dealt with by the application.

<unless method requires XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_REPORT

<CGI Support Global Definitions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. #define CALDAV_NS XML_NAME_URN_IETF_PARAMS_XML_NS_CALDAV

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_REPORT:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {

  3.     valid = FALSE;

  4.     break;

  5.   }

  6.   if(check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  7.     switch(xml_tag(node)) {

  8.       <Check known DAV: report types>

  9.       default:

  10.         break; /* ignore unknown tags */

  11.     }

  12.   else {

  13.     xmlNsPtr caldav_ns = NULL;

  14.     if(check_ns(node, CALDAV_NS, &caldav_ns))

  15.       switch(xml_tag(node)) {

  16.         <Check known CALDAV: report types>

  17.         default:

  18.           break; /* ignore unkown tags */

  19.       }

  20.   }

  21.   break;

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:caldav

RFC 3253 defines a number of version control-related report types.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT version-tree ANY>

  2.   <!-- 0 or more elements, at most one DAV:prop -->

  3.   <!-- other elements undefined -->

  4. <!ELEMENT expand-property (property*)>

  5.   <!ELEMENT property (property*)>

  6.   <!ATTLIST property name NMTOKEN #REQUIRED>

  7.   <!ATTLIST property namespace NMTOKEN "DAV:">

  8. <!ELEMENT locate-by-history (version-history-set, prop)>

  9.   <!ELEMENT version-history-set (href+)>

  10. <!ELEMENT merge-preview (source)>

  11.   <!ELEMENT source (href)>

  12. <!ELEMENT compare-baseline (href)>

  13. <!ELEMENT latest-activity-version (href)>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. version-tree expand-property locate-by-history merge-preview

  2. compare-baseline latest-activity-version

  3. name namespace version-history-set

<Check known DAV: report types>= (<-U) [D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_VERSION_TREE:

  2.   if((node = xml_child(node))) {

  3.     gboolean got_prop = FALSE;

  4.     for(; valid && node; node = node->next) {

  5.       valid = node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE;

  6.       if(valid && check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  7.          xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_PROP) {

  8.         valid = !got_prop && check_prop(node, FALSE);

  9.         got_prop = TRUE;

  10.       }

  11.     }

  12.   }

  13.   break;

<Check known DAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_EXPAND_PROPERTY:

  2.   valid = check_property(xml_child(node), &dav_ns);

  3.   break;

<Check known DAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_LOCATE_BY_HISTORY:

  2.   valid = (node = xml_child(node)) && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  3.           node->next && node->next->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  4.           !node->next->next && check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  5.           check_ns(node->next, DAV_NS, &dav_ns);

  6.   if(valid) {

  7.     xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  8.     if(tn == XML_NAME_PROP) {

  9.       valid = check_prop(node, FALSE);

  10.       node = node->next;

  11.       tn = xml_tag(node);

  12.     } else

  13.       valid = xml_tag(node->next) == XML_NAME_PROP &&

  14.               check_ns(node->next, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  15.               check_prop(node->next, FALSE);

  16.     if(valid)

  17.       valid = xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_VERSION_HISTORY_SET &&

  18.               xml_child(node);

  19.     for(node = xml_child(node); node && valid; node = node->next)

  20.       valid = node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  21.               xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_HREF &&

  22.               check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) && xml_child(node) &&

  23.               xmlNodeIsText(node->children);

  24.   }

  25.   break;

<Check known DAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_MERGE_PREVIEW:

  2.   valid = (node = xml_child(node)) && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  3.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_SOURCE &&

  4.           check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) && (node = xml_child(node)) &&

  5.           !node->next && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  6.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_HREF && xml_child(node) &&

  7.           !node->children->next && xmlNodeIsText(node->children) &&

  8.           check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns);

  9.   break;

<Check known DAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_COMPARE_BASELINE:

  2. case XML_NAME_LATEST_ACTIVITY_VERSION:

  3.   valid = (node = xml_child(node)) && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  4.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_HREF && xml_child(node) &&

  5.           !node->children->next && xmlNodeIsText(node->children) &&

  6.           check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns);

  7.   break;

<CGI Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. static gboolean check_property(xmlNodePtr node, xmlNsPtr *nsc)

  2. {

  3.   for(; node; node = node->next) {

  4.     xmlAttrPtr attrs;

  5.     gboolean got_name = FALSE;

  6.     xml_name_t an;

  7.     if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_PROPERTY ||

  8.        !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, nsc))

  9.       return FALSE;

  10.     for(attrs = node->properties; attrs; attrs = attrs->next)

  11.       if(check_ns((xmlNodePtr)attrs, DAV_NS, nsc) &&

  12.          ((an = xml_tag((xmlNodePtr)attrs)) == XML_NAME_NAME ||

  13.            an == XML_NAME_NAMESPACE)) {

  14.         /* no attempt to validate the actual text value as a name token */

  15.         if(!attrs->children || attrs->children->next ||

  16.            !xmlNodeIsText(attrs->children))

  17.           return FALSE;

  18.         if(an == XML_NAME_NAME)

  19.           got_name = TRUE;

  20.       }

  21.     if(!got_name)

  22.       return FALSE;

  23.     if(!check_property(xml_child(node), nsc))

  24.       return FALSE;

  25.   }

  26.   return TRUE;

  27. }

RFC 3744 defines a few ACL-related report types.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT acl-principal-prop-set ANY>

  2.   <!-- one or more children, with at most one prop element -->

  3.   <!-- all others to be ignored.  Note that lack of prop makes no sense -->

  4. <!ELEMENT principal-match ((principal-property | self), prop?)>

  5.   <!ELEMENT principal-property ANY>

  6.   <!-- ANY: an element whose value identifies a property -->

  7.   <!ELEMENT self EMPTY>

  8. <!ELEMENT principal-property-search

  9.     ((property-search+), prop?, apply-to-principal-collection-set?) >

  10.   <!ELEMENT property-search (prop, match) >

  11.     <!ELEMENT match #PCDATA >

  12.   <!-- apply-to-principal-collection-set unspecified, but presumed EMPTY -->

  13. <!ELEMENT principal-search-property-set EMPTY >

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. acl-principal-prop-set principal-match principal-property-search

  2. principal-search-property-set

  3. principal-property property-search match apply-to-principal-collection-set

<Check known DAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_ACL_PRINCIPAL_PROP_SET:

  2.   if(!xml_child(node))

  3.     valid = FALSE;

  4.   else {

  5.     gboolean got_prop = FALSE;

  6.     for(node = node->children; node && valid; node = node->next) {

  7.       valid = node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE;

  8.       if(valid && xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_PROP &&

  9.          check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)) {

  10.         valid = !got_prop && check_prop(node, FALSE);

  11.         got_prop = TRUE;

  12.       }

  13.     }

  14.   }

  15.   break;

<Check known DAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_PRINCIPAL_MATCH:

  2.   valid = (node = xml_child(node)) && (!node->next || !node->next->next) &&

  3.           node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE && check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  4.           (!node->next || (node->next->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  5.                         check_ns(node->next, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)));

  6.   if(valid) {

  7.     xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  8.     if(tn == XML_NAME_PROP) {

  9.       valid = check_prop(node, FALSE) && node->next;

  10.       if(valid) {

  11.         node = node->next;

  12.         tn = xml_tag(node);

  13.       }

  14.     }

  15.     if(tn == XML_NAME_SELF)

  16.       valid = !xml_child(node);

  17.     else if(tn == XML_NAME_PRINCIPAL_PROPERTY)

  18.       valid = xml_child(node) && !node->children->next &&

  19.               check_prop(node, FALSE);

  20.     else

  21.       valid = FALSE;

  22.     if(valid && node->next)

  23.       valid = xml_tag(node->next) == XML_NAME_PROP &&

  24.               check_prop(node->next, FALSE);

  25.   }

  26.   break;

<Check known DAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_PRINCIPAL_PROPERTY_SEARCH:

  2.   if(!xml_child(node))

  3.     valid = FALSE;

  4.   else {

  5.     gboolean got_ps = FALSE, got_prop = FALSE, got_atpcs = FALSE;

  6.     for(node = node->children; node && valid; node = node->next) {

  7.       xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  8.       if(tn == XML_NAME_PROPERTY_SEARCH) {

  9.         got_ps = TRUE;

  10.         valid = xml_child(node) && node->children->next && !node->children->next->next &&

  11.                 node->children->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  12.                 node->children->next->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  13.                 check_ns(node->children, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  14.                 check_ns(node->children->next, DAV_NS, &dav_ns);

  15.         if(valid) {

  16.           xmlNodePtr c = node->children;

  17.           tn = xml_tag(c);

  18.           if(tn == XML_NAME_PROP) {

  19.             valid = check_prop(c, FALSE);

  20.             c = c->next;

  21.             tn = xml_tag(c);

  22.           } else

  23.             valid = xml_tag(c->next) == XML_NAME_PROP &&

  24.                     check_prop(c->next, FALSE);

  25.           if(valid)

  26.             valid = tn == XML_NAME_MATCH && xml_child(c) &&

  27.                     xmlNodeIsText(c->children) &&

  28.                     !c->children->next;

  29.         }

  30.       } else if(tn == XML_NAME_PROP) {

  31.         valid = !got_prop && check_prop(node, FALSE);

  32.         got_prop = TRUE;

  33.       } else if(tn == XML_NAME_APPLY_TO_PRINCIPAL_COLLECTION_SET) {

  34.         valid = !got_atpcs && !xml_child(node);

  35.         got_atpcs = TRUE;

  36.       }

  37.     }

  38.     valid = valid && got_ps;

  39.   }

  40.   break;

<Check known DAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. case XML_NAME_PRINCIPAL_SEARCH_PROPERTY_SET:

  2.   valid = !xml_child(node);

  3.   break;

Finally, RFC 4791 defines a few calendaring report types in the urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:caldav namespace. Note that unlike the other methods, calendaring reports specify properties using children of calendar-data rather than using properties directly under prop.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT calendar-query ((DAV:allprop |

  2.                                  DAV:propname |

  3.                                  DAV:prop)?, filter, timezone?)>

  4.   <!ELEMENT filter (comp-filter)>

  5.     <!ELEMENT comp-filter (is-not-defined | (time-range?,

  6.                              prop-filter*, comp-filter*))>

  7.       <!ATTLIST comp-filter name CDATA #REQUIRED>

  8.       <!ELEMENT is-not-defined EMPTY>

  9.       <!ELEMENT time-range EMPTY>

  10.         <!ATTLIST time-range start CDATA #IMPLIED

  11.                              end   CDATA #IMPLIED>

  12.       <!ELEMENT prop-filter (is-not-defined |

  13.                              ((time-range | text-match)?,

  14.                               param-filter*))>

  15.         <!ATTLIST prop-filter name CDATA #REQUIRED>

  16.         <!ELEMENT text-match (#PCDATA)>

  17.           <!ATTLIST text-match collation        CDATA "i;ascii-casemap"

  18.                                negate-condition (yes | no) "no">

  19.         <!ELEMENT param-filter (is-not-defined | text-match?)>

  20.           <!ATTLIST param-filter name CDATA #REQUIRED>

  21.   <!ELEMENT timezone (#PCDATA)>

  22. <!ELEMENT calendar-multiget ((DAV:allprop |

  23.                                    DAV:propname |

  24.                                    DAV:prop)?, DAV:href+)>

  25. <!ELEMENT free-busy-query (time-range)>

  26. <!ELEMENT calendar-data (comp?, (expand | limit-recurrence-set)?,

  27.                                 limit-freebusy-set?)>

  28.   <!ATTLIST calendar-data content-type CDATA "text/calendar"

  29.                               version CDATA "2.0">

  30.   <!-- actual samples seem to indicate there should ?s after all{prop,comp} -->

  31.   <!ELEMENT comp ((allprop | prop*), (allcomp | comp*))>

  32.     <!ATTLIST comp name CDATA #REQUIRED>

  33.     <!ELEMENT allcomp EMPTY>

  34.     <!ELEMENT allprop EMPTY>

  35.     <!ELEMENT prop EMPTY>

  36.       <!ATTLIST prop name CDATA #REQUIRED

  37.                      novalue (yes | no) "no">

  38.   <!ELEMENT expand EMPTY>

  39.     <!ATTLIST expand start CDATA #REQUIRED

  40.                        end   CDATA #REQUIRED>

  41.   <!ELEMENT limit-recurrence-set EMPTY>

  42.     <!ATTLIST limit-recurrence-set start CDATA #REQUIRED

  43.                                      end   CDATA #REQUIRED>

  44.   <!ELEMENT limit-freebusy-set EMPTY>

  45.     <!ATTLIST limit-freebusy-set start CDATA #REQUIRED

  46.                                    end   CDATA #REQUIRED>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. calendar-query calendar-multiget free-busy-query

  2. filter comp-filter is-not-defined time-range prop-filter start end text-match

  3. collation negate-condition timezone param-filter

  4. calendar-data comp expand limit-recurrence-set limit-freebusy-set

  5. content-type version allcomp novalue

<Check known CALDAV: report types>= (<-U) [D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_CALENDAR_QUERY: {

  2.   gboolean got_prop = FALSE, got_filt = FALSE, got_tz = FALSE;

  3.   xml_name_t tn;

  4.   for(node = xml_child(node); node && valid; node = node->next) {

  5.     if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {

  6.       valid = FALSE;

  7.       break;

  8.     }

  9.     tn = xml_tag(node);

  10.     if(check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)) {

  11.       valid = (tn == XML_NAME_ALLPROP || tn == XML_NAME_PROP ||

  12.                tn == XML_NAME_PROPNAME) && !got_prop;

  13.       if(valid) {

  14.         got_prop = TRUE;

  15.         if(tn == XML_NAME_PROP)

  16.           valid = check_caldav_prop(node, &caldav_ns);

  17.         else

  18.           valid = !xml_child(node);

  19.       }

  20.     } else if(check_ns(node, CALDAV_NS, &caldav_ns)) {

  21.       if(tn == XML_NAME_FILTER) {

  22.         valid = !got_filt && xml_child(node) &&

  23.                 node->children->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  24.                 !node->children->next &&

  25.                 check_ns(node->children, CALDAV_NS, &caldav_ns) &&

  26.                 xml_tag(node->children) == XML_NAME_COMP_FILTER;

  27.         got_filt = TRUE;

  28.         if(valid)

  29.           valid = check_comp_filter(node->children, &caldav_ns);

  30.       } else if(tn == XML_NAME_TIMEZONE) {

  31.         /* no attempt to validate tz format */

  32.         valid = xml_child(node) && xmlNodeIsText(node->children) &&

  33.                 !node->children->next && !got_tz;

  34.         got_tz = TRUE;

  35.       } else

  36.         valid = FALSE;

  37.     } else

  38.       valid = FALSE;

  39.   }

  40.   valid = valid && got_filt;

  41.   break;

  42. }

<CGI Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. static gboolean check_caldav_prop(xmlNodePtr node, xmlNsPtr *nsc)

  2. {

  3.   if(!xml_child(node))

  4.     return FALSE;

  5.   for(node = node->children; node; node = node->next) {

  6.     if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || !node->ns || !node->ns->href)

  7.       return FALSE;

  8.     if(xml_child(node)) {

  9.       if(!check_ns(node, CALDAV_NS, nsc) ||

  10.          xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_CALENDAR_DATA)

  11.         return FALSE;

  12.       xmlAttrPtr attrs;

  13.       xml_name_t tn;

  14.       for(attrs = node->properties; attrs; attrs = attrs->next)

  15.         if(check_ns((xmlNodePtr)attrs, CALDAV_NS, nsc) &&

  16.            ((tn = xml_tag((xmlNodePtr)attrs)) == XML_NAME_CONTENT_TYPE ||

  17.             tn == XML_NAME_VERSION) &&

  18.            attrs->children && (attrs->children->next ||

  19.                                !xmlNodeIsText(attrs->children)))

  20.           return FALSE;

  21.       gboolean got_comp = FALSE, got_explrs = FALSE, got_lfs = FALSE;

  22.       xmlNodePtr c;

  23.       for(c = xml_child(node); c; c = c->next) {

  24.         if(c->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || !check_ns(c, CALDAV_NS, nsc))

  25.           return FALSE;

  26.         tn = xml_tag(c);

  27.         if(tn == XML_NAME_COMP) {

  28.           if(got_comp || !check_caldav_comp(c, nsc))

  29.             return FALSE;

  30.           got_comp = TRUE;

  31.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_EXPAND || tn == XML_NAME_LIMIT_RECURRENCE_SET) {

  32.           if(got_explrs || xml_child(c) ||

  33.              !check_timerange_attr(c, FALSE, nsc))

  34.             return FALSE;

  35.           got_explrs = TRUE;

  36.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_LIMIT_FREEBUSY_SET) {

  37.           if(got_lfs || xml_child(c) ||

  38.              !check_timerange_attr(c, FALSE, nsc))

  39.             return FALSE;

  40.           got_lfs = TRUE;

  41.         } else

  42.           return FALSE;

  43.       }

  44.     }

  45.   }

  46.   return TRUE;

  47. }

<CGI Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. static gboolean check_comp_filter(xmlNodePtr node, xmlNsPtr *nsc)

  2. {

  3.   xml_name_t tn;

  4.   if(!check_name_attr(node, nsc))

  5.     return FALSE;

  6.   /* no explicit text to guarantee children, so x | (? * *)  means optional */

  7.   if(!xml_child(node))

  8.     return TRUE;

  9.   gboolean got_ind = FALSE, got_tr = FALSE;

  10.   for(node = node->children; node; node = node->next) {

  11.     if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || !check_ns(node, CALDAV_NS, nsc))

  12.       return FALSE;

  13.     if((tn = xml_tag(node)) == XML_NAME_IS_NOT_DEFINED && got_ind)

  14.       return FALSE;

  15.     got_ind = TRUE; /* prevent ind later even if tag wasn't ind */

  16.     if(tn == XML_NAME_IS_NOT_DEFINED) {

  17.       if(xml_child(node))

  18.         return FALSE;

  19.     } else if(tn == XML_NAME_TIME_RANGE) {

  20.       if(!check_timerange_attr(node, TRUE, nsc) || xml_child(node) || got_tr)

  21.         return FALSE;

  22.       got_tr = TRUE;

  23.     } else if(tn == XML_NAME_COMP_FILTER) {

  24.       if(!check_comp_filter(node, nsc))

  25.         return FALSE;

  26.    } else if(tn == XML_NAME_PROP_FILTER) {

  27.      xmlNodePtr c;

  28.      gboolean got_trm = FALSE, got_ind2 = FALSE;

  29.      if(!check_name_attr(node, nsc))

  30.        return FALSE;

  31.       for(c = xml_child(node); c; c = c->next) {

  32.         if(c->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || !check_ns(c, CALDAV_NS, nsc))

  33.           return FALSE;

  34.         if((tn = xml_tag(c)) == XML_NAME_IS_NOT_DEFINED && got_ind2)

  35.           return FALSE;

  36.         got_ind2 = TRUE;

  37.         if(tn == XML_NAME_IS_NOT_DEFINED) {

  38.           if(xml_child(c))

  39.             return FALSE;

  40.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_TIME_RANGE) {

  41.           if(!check_timerange_attr(c, TRUE, nsc) || xml_child(c) || got_trm)

  42.             return FALSE;

  43.           got_trm = TRUE;

  44.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_TEXT_MATCH) {

  45.           if(got_trm || !check_text_match(c, nsc))

  46.             return FALSE;

  47.           got_trm = TRUE;

  48.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_PARAM_FILTER) {

  49.           if(!check_name_attr(c, nsc))

  50.             return FALSE;

  51.           if(xml_child(c)) {

  52.             if(c->children->next || c->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  53.                !check_ns(c, CALDAV_NS, nsc))

  54.               return FALSE;

  55.             if((tn = xml_tag(c->children)) == XML_NAME_IS_NOT_DEFINED) {

  56.               if(xml_child(c->children))

  57.                 return FALSE;

  58.             } else if(tn == XML_NAME_TEXT_MATCH) {

  59.               if(!check_text_match(c->children, nsc))

  60.                 return FALSE;

  61.             } else

  62.               return FALSE;

  63.           }

  64.         } else

  65.           return FALSE;

  66.       }

  67.     } else

  68.       return FALSE;

  69.   }

  70.   return TRUE;

  71. }

<CGI Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. static gboolean check_timerange_attr(xmlNodePtr node, gboolean open_range,

  2.                                      xmlNsPtr *nsc)

  3. {

  4.   xmlAttrPtr attrs;

  5.   gboolean got_start = FALSE, got_end = FALSE;

  6.   xml_name_t tn;

  7.   for(attrs = node->properties; attrs; attrs = attrs->next)

  8.     if(check_ns((xmlNodePtr)attrs, CALDAV_NS, nsc)) {

  9.       if((tn = xml_tag((xmlNodePtr)attrs)) == XML_NAME_START)

  10.         got_start = TRUE;

  11.       else if(tn == XML_NAME_END)

  12.         got_end = TRUE;

  13.       else

  14.         continue;

  15.       /* no attempt to verify date is valid */

  16.       if(!attrs->children || attrs->children->next ||

  17.          !xmlNodeIsText(attrs->children))

  18.         return FALSE;

  19.     }

  20.   return open_range ? got_start || got_end : got_start && got_end;

  21. }

<CGI Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. static gboolean check_name_attr(xmlNodePtr node, xmlNsPtr *nsc)

  2. {

  3.   xmlAttrPtr attrs;

  4.   for(attrs = node->properties; attrs; attrs = attrs->next)

  5.     if(xml_tag((xmlNodePtr)attrs) == XML_NAME_NAME &&

  6.        check_ns((xmlNodePtr)attrs, CALDAV_NS, nsc))

  7.       /* no attempt to verify name is valid */

  8.       return attrs->children && !attrs->children->next &&

  9.              xmlNodeIsText(attrs->children);

  10.   return FALSE;

  11. }

<CGI Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. static gboolean check_caldav_comp(xmlNodePtr node, xmlNsPtr *nsc)

  2. {

  3.   /* actual samples indicate children not really necessary */

  4. #if 0

  5.   if(!xml_child(node) || !check_name_attr(node, nsc))

  6. #else

  7.   if(!check_name_attr(node, nsc))

  8. #endif

  9.     return FALSE;

  10.   gboolean got_prop = FALSE, got_allprop = FALSE, got_comp = FALSE,

  11.            got_allcomp = FALSE;

  12.   xml_name_t tn;

  13.   for(node = xml_child(node); node; node = node->next) {

  14.     if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || !check_ns(node, CALDAV_NS, nsc))

  15.       return FALSE;

  16.     tn = xml_tag(node);

  17.     if(tn == XML_NAME_ALLCOMP) {

  18.       if(got_comp || got_allcomp || xml_child(node))

  19.         return FALSE;

  20.       got_allcomp = TRUE;

  21.     } else if(tn == XML_NAME_ALLPROP) {

  22.       if(got_prop || got_allprop || xml_child(node))

  23.         return FALSE;

  24.       got_allprop = TRUE;

  25.     } else if(tn == XML_NAME_COMP) {

  26.       if(got_allcomp || !check_caldav_comp(node, nsc))

  27.         return FALSE;

  28.       got_comp = TRUE;

  29.     } else if(tn == XML_NAME_PROP) {

  30.       if(got_allprop)

  31.         return FALSE;

  32.       got_prop = TRUE;

  33.       xmlAttrPtr attrs;

  34.       gboolean got_name = FALSE;

  35.       for(attrs = node->properties; attrs; attrs = attrs->next) {

  36.         if(!check_ns((xmlNodePtr)attrs, CALDAV_NS, nsc))

  37.           continue;

  38.         if((tn = xml_tag((xmlNodePtr)attrs)) == XML_NAME_NAME)

  39.           got_name = attrs->children && !attrs->children->next &&

  40.                      xmlNodeIsText(attrs->children);

  41.         else if(tn == XML_NAME_NOVALUE) {

  42.           if((tn = xml_str_id(attrs->children)) != XML_NAME_YES &&

  43.              tn != XML_NAME_NO)

  44.             return FALSE;

  45.         } else

  46.           return FALSE;

  47.       }

  48.       if(!got_name)

  49.         return FALSE;

  50.     } else

  51.       return FALSE;

  52.   }

  53. #if 0

  54.   /* actual samples seem to indicate allprop/allcomp is implicit */

  55.   return (got_prop || got_allprop) && (got_comp || got_allcomp);

  56. #else

  57.   return TRUE;

  58. #endif

  59. }

<CGI Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. static gboolean check_text_match(xmlNodePtr node, xmlNsPtr *nsc)

  2. {

  3.   xmlAttrPtr attrs;

  4.   xml_name_t tn;

  5.   if(!xml_child(node) || node->children->next || !xmlNodeIsText(node->children))

  6.     return FALSE;

  7.   for(attrs = node->properties; attrs; attrs = attrs->next) {

  8.     if(!check_ns((xmlNodePtr)attrs, CALDAV_NS, nsc))

  9.       continue;

  10.     if((tn = xml_tag((xmlNodePtr)attrs)) == XML_NAME_COLLATION) {

  11.       if(!attrs->children || attrs->children->next ||

  12.          !xmlNodeIsText(attrs->children))

  13.         return FALSE;

  14.      } else if(tn == XML_NAME_NEGATE_CONDITION) {

  15.       if(!attrs->children || attrs->children->next ||

  16.          !xmlNodeIsText(attrs->children))

  17.         return FALSE;

  18.       if((tn = xml_str_id(attrs->children->content)) != XML_NAME_YES &&

  19.          tn != XML_NAME_NO)

  20.         return FALSE;

  21.     }

  22.   }

  23.   return TRUE;

  24. }

<Check known CALDAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case XML_NAME_CALENDAR_MULTIGET: {

  2.   gboolean got_prop = FALSE, got_hr = FALSE;

  3.   for(node = xml_child(node); node; node = node->next) {

  4.     if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)) {

  5.       valid = FALSE;

  6.       break;

  7.     }

  8.     xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  9.     if(tn == XML_NAME_ALLPROP || tn == XML_NAME_PROP)

  10.       valid = !xml_child(node) && !got_prop;

  11.     else if(tn == XML_NAME_PROP)

  12.       valid = !got_prop && check_prop(node, FALSE);

  13.     else if(tn == XML_NAME_HREF)

  14.       valid  = xml_child(node) && !node->children->next &&

  15.                xmlNodeIsText(node->children);

  16.     else

  17.       valid = FALSE;

  18.     if(tn == XML_NAME_HREF)

  19.       got_hr = TRUE;

  20.     else

  21.       got_prop = TRUE;

  22.   }

  23.   valid = valid && got_hr;

  24.   break;

  25. }

<Check known CALDAV: report types>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. case XML_NAME_FREE_BUSY_QUERY:

  2.   valid = (node = xml_child(node)) && !node->next &&

  3.           node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  4.           check_ns(node, CALDAV_NS, &caldav_ns) &&

  5.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_TIME_RANGE &&

  6.           check_timerange_attr(node, TRUE, &caldav_ns);

  7.   break;

The VERSION-CONTROL method takes an optional body with a version-control element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT version-control ANY>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. version-control

<unless method requires no body or XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_VERSION_CONTROL

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_VERSION_CONTROL:

  2.   valid = !node->next && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  3.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_VERSION_CONTROL &&

  4.           check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns);

  5.   break;

The CHECKOUT method takes an optional body with a checkout element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT checkout ANY>

  2.   <!-- children may have at most one fork-ok, but otherwise elements -->

  3.   <!ELEMENT fork-ok EMPTY>

  4.   <!-- or at most one apply-to-version -->

  5.   <!ELEMENT apply-to-version EMPTY>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. checkout fork-ok apply-to-version

<unless method requires no body or XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_CHECKOUT

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_CHECKOUT:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  3.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_CHECKOUT || !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  4.     valid = FALSE;

  5.   else {

  6.     gboolean got_fok = FALSE, got_atv = FALSE;

  7.     for(node = xml_child(node); node && valid; node = node->next) {

  8.       if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE)

  9.         valid = FALSE;

  10.       else if(check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)) {

  11.         xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  12.         if(tn == XML_NAME_FORK_OK) {

  13.           valid = !got_fok && !xml_child(node);

  14.           got_fok = TRUE;

  15.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_APPLY_TO_VERSION) {

  16.           valid = !got_atv && !xml_child(node);

  17.           got_atv = TRUE;

  18.         }

  19.       }

  20.     }

  21.   }

  22.   break;

The CHECKIN method takes an optional body with a checkin element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT checkin ANY>

  2.   <!-- children may have at most one fork-ok and keep-checked-out + other el -->

  3.   <!ELEMENT keep-checked-out EMPTY>

  4.   <!ELEMENT fork-ok EMPTY>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. checkin keep-checked-out

<unless method requires no body or XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_CHECKIN

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_CHECKIN:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  3.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_CHECKOUT || !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  4.     valid = FALSE;

  5.   else {

  6.     gboolean got_fok = FALSE, got_kco = FALSE;

  7.     for(node = xml_child(node); node && valid; node = node->next) {

  8.       if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE)

  9.         valid = FALSE;

  10.       else if(check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)) {

  11.         xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  12.         if(tn == XML_NAME_FORK_OK) {

  13.           valid = !got_fok && !xml_child(node);

  14.           got_fok = TRUE;

  15.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_KEEP_CHECKED_OUT) {

  16.           valid = !got_kco && !xml_child(node);

  17.           got_kco = TRUE;

  18.         }

  19.       }

  20.     }

  21.   }

  22.   break;

The UNCHECKOUT method takes an optional body with an uncheckout element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT uncheckout ANY>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. uncheckout

<unless method requires no body or XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_UNCHECKOUT

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_UNCHECKOUT:

  2.   valid = !node->next && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  3.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_UNCHECKOUT &&

  4.           check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns);

  5.   break;

The MKWORKSPACE method takes an optional body with a mkworkspace element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT mkworkspace ANY>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. mkworkspace

<unless method requires no body or XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_MKWORKSPACE

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_MKWORKSPACE:

  2.   valid = !node->next && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  3.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_MKWORKSPACE &&

  4.           check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns);

  5.   break;

The UPDATE method requires an XML body with a an update element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT update ANY>

  2.   <!-- ANY: elements with at most one version & one prop -->

  3.   <!ELEMENT version (href)>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. update

<unless method requires XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_UPDATE

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_UPDATE:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  3.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_UPDATE || !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  4.     valid = FALSE;

  5.   else {

  6.     gboolean got_vers = FALSE, got_prop = FALSE;

  7.     for(node = xml_child(node); node && valid; node = node->next) {

  8.       if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE)

  9.         valid = FALSE;

  10.       else if(check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)) {

  11.         xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  12.         if(tn == XML_NAME_VERSION) {

  13.           valid = !got_vers && xml_child(node) && !node->children->next &&

  14.                   node->children->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  15.                   xml_tag(node->children) == XML_NAME_HREF &&

  16.                   check_ns(node->children, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  17.                   xml_child(node->children) && !node->children->children->next &&

  18.                   xmlNodeIsText(node->children->children);

  19.           got_vers = TRUE;

  20.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_PROP) {

  21.           /* no help in RFC on what format is, so be inclusive */

  22.           valid = !got_prop && check_prop(node, TRUE);

  23.           got_prop = TRUE;

  24.         }

  25.       }

  26.     }

  27.   }

  28.   break;

The LABEL method requires an XML body with a label element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT label ANY>

  2.   <!-- any elements, but at most one add, set, or remove -->

  3.   <!ELEMENT add (label-name)>

  4.     <!ELEMENT label-name (#PCDATA)>

  5.   <!ELEMENT set (label-name)>

  6.   <!ELEMENT remove (label-name)>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. label add label-name

<unless method requires XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_LABEL

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_LABEL:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  3.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_LABEL || !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  4.     valid = FALSE;

  5.   else {

  6.     gboolean got_one = FALSE;

  7.     for(node = xml_child(node); node && valid; node = node->next) {

  8.       if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE)

  9.         valid = FALSE;

  10.       else if(check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)) {

  11.         xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  12.         if(tn == XML_NAME_SET || tn == XML_NAME_ADD || tn == XML_NAME_REMOVE) {

  13.           valid = !got_one && xml_child(node) && !node->children->next &&

  14.                   node->children->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  15.                   xml_tag(node->children) == XML_NAME_LABEL_NAME &&

  16.                   check_ns(node->children, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  17.                   xml_child(node->children) && !node->children->children->next &&

  18.                   xmlNodeIsText(node->children->children);

  19.           got_one = TRUE;

  20.         }

  21.       }

  22.     }

  23.   }

  24.   break;

The MERGE method requires an XML body with a merge element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT merge ANY>

  2.   <!-- ANY is elements with one source, at most one no-auto-merge, no-checkout,

  3.        prop, update parms (fork-ok, apply-to-version) -->

  4.   <!ELEMENT source (href+)>

  5.   <!ELEMENT no-auto-merge EMPTY>

  6.   <!ELEMENT no-checkout EMPTY>

  7.   <!ELEMENT fork-ok EMPTY>

  8.   <!ELEMENT apply-to-version EMPTY>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. merge source no-auto-merge no-checkout

<unless method requires XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_MERGE

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_MERGE:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  3.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_MERGE || !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  4.     valid = FALSE;

  5.   else {

  6.     gboolean got_src = FALSE, got_noam = FALSE, got_nc = FALSE,

  7.              got_fok = FALSE, got_atv = FALSE;

  8.     for(node = xml_child(node); node; node = node->next) {

  9.       if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE)

  10.         valid = FALSE;

  11.       else if(check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)) {

  12.         xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  13.         if(tn == XML_NAME_NO_AUTO_MERGE) {

  14.           valid = !xml_child(node) && !got_noam;

  15.           got_noam = TRUE;

  16.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_NO_CHECKOUT) {

  17.           valid = !xml_child(node) && !got_nc;

  18.           got_nc = TRUE;

  19.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_FORK_OK) {

  20.           valid = !xml_child(node) && !got_fok;

  21.           got_fok = TRUE;

  22.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_APPLY_TO_VERSION) {

  23.           valid = !xml_child(node) && !got_atv;

  24.           got_atv = TRUE;

  25.         } else if(tn == XML_NAME_SOURCE) {

  26.           valid = !got_src && xml_child(node);

  27.           got_src = TRUE;

  28.           xmlNodePtr c;

  29.           for(c = xml_child(node); c && valid; c = c->next)

  30.             valid = c->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  31.                     check_ns(c, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  32.                     xml_tag(c) == XML_NAME_HREF &&

  33.                     xml_child(c) && !c->children->next &&

  34.                     xmlNodeIsText(c->children);

  35.         }

  36.       }

  37.     }

  38.     valid = valid && got_src;

  39.   }

  40.   break;

The BASELINE-CONTROL method takes an optional body with a baseline-control element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT baseline-control ANY>

  2.   <!-- ANY is elements w/ at most one baseline -->

  3.   <!ELEMENT baseline (href)>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. baseline-control baseline

<unless method requires no body or XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_BASELINE_CONTROL

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_BASELINE_CONTROL:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  3.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_BASELINE_CONTROL ||

  4.      !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  5.     valid = FALSE;

  6.   else {

  7.     gboolean got_bl = FALSE;

  8.     for(node = xml_child(node); node && valid; node = node->next) {

  9.       if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE)

  10.         valid = FALSE;

  11.       else if(check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns)) {

  12.         xml_name_t tn = xml_tag(node);

  13.         if(tn == XML_NAME_BASELINE) {

  14.           valid = !got_bl && xml_child(node) && !node->children->next &&

  15.                   node->children->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  16.                   xml_tag(node->children) == XML_NAME_HREF &&

  17.                   check_ns(node->children, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  18.                   xml_child(node->children) && !node->children->children->next &&

  19.                   xmlNodeIsText(node->children->children);

  20.           got_bl = TRUE;

  21.         }

  22.       }

  23.     }

  24.   }

  25.   break;

The MKACTIVITY method takes an optional body with a mkactivity element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT mkactivity ANY>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. mkactivity

<unless method requires no body or XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_MKACTIVITY

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_MKACTIVITY:

  2.   valid = !node->next && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  3.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_MKACTIVITY &&

  4.           check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns);

  5.   break;

The ORDERPATCH requires an XML body with an orderpatch element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT orderpatch (ordering-type?, order-member*) >

  2.   <!ELEMENT ordering-type (href) >

  3.   <!ELEMENT order-member (segment, position) >

  4.     <!ELEMENT segment (#PCDATA)>

  5.     <!ELEMENT position (first | last | before | after)>

  6.       <!ELEMENT first EMPTY >

  7.       <!ELEMENT last EMPTY >

  8.       <!ELEMENT before segment >

  9.       <!ELEMENT after segment >

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. orderpatch ordering-type order-member segment position first last before after

<unless method requires XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_ORDERPATCH

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_ORDERPATCH:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  3.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_ORDERPATCH || !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  4.     valid = FALSE;

  5.   else {

  6.     gboolean got_ot = FALSE;

  7.     xml_name_t tn;

  8.     xmlNodePtr c;

  9.     for(node = xml_child(node); node && valid; node = node->next) {

  10.       if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || !(c = xml_child(node)) ||

  11.          c->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) ||

  12.          !check_ns(c, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  13.         valid = FALSE;

  14.       else if((tn = xml_tag(node)) == XML_NAME_ORDERING_TYPE) {

  15.         valid = !got_ot && !c->next && xml_tag(c) == XML_NAME_HREF &&

  16.                 xml_child(c) && !c->children->next &&

  17.                 xmlNodeIsText(c->children);

  18.         got_ot = TRUE;

  19.       } else if(tn == XML_NAME_ORDER_MEMBER) {

  20.         valid = c->next && !c->next->next &&

  21.                 c->next->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  22.                 check_ns(c->next, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  23.                 xml_child(c) && !c->children->next &&

  24.                 xml_child(c->next) && !c->next->children->next;

  25.         if(valid) {

  26.           tn = xml_tag(c);

  27.           if(tn == XML_NAME_SEGMENT) {

  28.             valid = xmlNodeIsText(c->children);

  29.             c = c->next;

  30.             tn = xml_tag(c);

  31.           }

  32.           if(valid && tn == XML_NAME_POSITION) {

  33.             valid = c->children->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  34.                     check_ns(c->children, DAV_NS, &dav_ns);

  35.             if(valid) {

  36.               tn = xml_tag(c->children);

  37.               if(tn == XML_NAME_FIRST || tn == XML_NAME_LAST)

  38.                 valid = !c->children->children;

  39.               else if(tn == XML_NAME_BEFORE || tn == XML_NAME_AFTER) {

  40.                 xmlNodePtr subc = xml_child(c->children);

  41.                 valid = subc && !subc->next &&

  42.                         subc->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  43.                         check_ns(subc, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  44.                         xml_tag(subc) == XML_NAME_SEGMENT &&

  45.                         xml_child(subc) && !subc->children->next &&

  46.                         xmlNodeIsText(subc->children);

  47.               } else

  48.                 valid = FALSE;

  49.             }

  50.           } else

  51.             valid = FALSE;

  52.           if(valid && (c = c->next))

  53.             valid = xml_tag(c) == XML_NAME_SEGMENT &&

  54.                     xmlNodeIsText(xml_child(c));

  55.         }

  56.       } else

  57.         valid = FALSE;

  58.     }

  59.   }

  60.   break;

The MKREDIRECTREF method requires an XML body with a mkredirectref element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT mkredirectref (reftarget, redirect-lifetime?)>

  2.   <!ELEMENT reftarget (href)>

  3.   <!ELEMENT redirect-lifetime (permanent | temporary)>

  4.     <!ELEMENT permanent EMPTY>

  5.     <!ELEMENT temporary EMPTY>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. mkredirectref reftarget redirect-lifetime permanent temporary

<unless method requires XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_MKREDIRECTREF

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_MKREDIRECTREF:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  3.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_MKREDIRECTREF ||

  4.      !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  5.     valid = FALSE;

  6.   else {

  7.     <Check redirect reference creation XML>

  8.     valid = valid && got_rt;

  9.   }

  10.   break;

<Check redirect reference creation XML>= (<-U U->)

  1. gboolean got_rt = FALSE, got_rl = FALSE;

  2. for(node = xml_child(node); node && valid; node = node->next) {

  3.   xml_name_t tn;

  4.   xmlNodePtr c;

  5.   if(node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || !(c = xml_child(node)) ||

  6.      c->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE || c->next ||

  7.      !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) || !check_ns(c, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  8.     valid = FALSE;

  9.   else if((tn = xml_tag(node)) == XML_NAME_REFTARGET) {

  10.     valid = !got_rt && xml_tag(c) == XML_NAME_HREF &&

  11.             xml_child(c) && xmlNodeIsText(c->children) && !c->children->next;

  12.     got_rt = TRUE;

  13.   } else if((tn = xml_tag(node)) == XML_NAME_REDIRECT_LIFETIME) {

  14.     valid = !got_rl && !xml_child(c) &&

  15.             ((tn = xml_tag(node)) == XML_NAME_PERMANENT ||

  16.              tn == XML_NAME_TEMPORARY);

  17.     got_rl = TRUE;

  18.   } else

  19.     valid = FALSE;

  20. }

The UPDATEREDIRECTREF method requires an XML body with an updateredirectref element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D->]

  1. <!ELEMENT updateredirectref (reftarget?, redirect-lifetime?)>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. updateredirectref

<unless method requires XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_UPDATEREDIRECTREF

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_UPDATEREDIRECTREF:

  2.   if(node->next || node->type != XML_ELEMENT_NODE ||

  3.      xml_tag(node) != XML_NAME_UPDATEREDIRECTREF ||

  4.      !check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns))

  5.     valid = FALSE;

  6.   else {

  7.     <Check redirect reference creation XML>

  8.   }

  9.   break;

The MKCALENDAR method takes an optional body with a mkcalendar element.

<webdav.dtd>+= [<-D]

  1. <!ELEMENT mkcalendar (DAV:set)>

<XML validator names>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. mkcalendar

<unless method requires no body or XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_MKCALENDAR

<Check WebDAV XML body>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. case HTTP_REQ_MKCALENDAR:

  2.   valid = !node->next && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  3.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_MKCALENDAR &&

  4.           check_ns(node, CALDAV_NS, NULL) &&

  5.           (node = xml_child(node)) && !node->next &&

  6.           node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  7.           check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  8.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_SET && (node = xml_child(node)) &&

  9.           !node->next && node->type == XML_ELEMENT_NODE &&

  10.           check_ns(node, DAV_NS, &dav_ns) &&

  11.           xml_tag(node) == XML_NAME_PROP && check_prop(node, TRUE);

  12.   break;

Methods which require that no body be present are the GET, HEAD, DELETE, COPY, MOVE, and UNLOCK requests. There is no defined use for the OPTIONS body, but the standard implies that it should be accepted and ignored. The TRACE and CONNECT methods are assumed to be handled by the server; if not, any checks can be done in the application.

<unless method requires no body>= (<-U)

  1. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_DELETE && req_method != HTTP_REQ_COPY

  2. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_MOVE   && req_method != HTTP_REQ_UNLOCK

  3. && req_method != HTTP_REQ_GET    && req_method != HTTP_REQ_HEAD

Session Support

Persistent sessions require shared state between independent CGI invocations, possibly in different processes. If those independent CGI invocations are also on different machines, the shared state will need to be served off of a central server. With this in mind, the traditional approach is to use a database connection to a central server to store session state. Implementing this in a generic manner for all databases is not practical, so a simple single-host file-based session manager is presented here.

<(cs-glib.nw) Library cs-supt Members>+= [<-D->]

  1. session.o

<session.c>=

  1. <(build.nw) Common C Header>

  2. <CGI Session Support Variables>

  3. <CGI Session Support Functions>

Initialization of the session routines is dependent on the method used to store the session. The default init_cgi_session is only to be used when the simple file-based sessions are used. Any other such routine should probably call init_cgi as well, since it is intended to be a replacement.

<CGI Session Support Functions>= (<-U) [D->]

  1. void init_cgi_session(void)

  2. {

  3.   init_cgi();

  4.   <Initialize file-based session support>

  5. }

A session requires a unique identifier, and of course the associated persistent state. The identifier and session ID are stored in the CGI state. The session ID's memory is expected to be allocated from the heap, so it is automatically freed when necessary. The session HDF is likewise a freshly allocated HDF; transferring the state for template users will require an HDF copy.

<CGI State Members>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. char *sessionid;

  2. HDF *session;

<Free CGI state members>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. if(cgi_state->sessionid)

  2.   free(cgi_state->sessionid);

  3. if(cgi_state->session)

  4.   hdf_destroy(&cgi_state->session);

The unique identifier is generated by a session creation function. It is expected that the state is already initialized with session identification information, so it expects that the session is non-empty, and creates the session with those initial values. If there happens to already be a session ID, it is simply ignored.

<CGI State Dependencies>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. typedef NEOERR *(*session_create_cb)(cgi_state_t *cgi_state);

<CGI State Members>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. session_create_cb create_session;

  2. void *session_cb_data;

<CGI Session Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. NEOERR *create_session_state(cgi_state_t *cgi_state)

  2. {

  3.   NEOERR *nerr;

  4.   time_t now;

  5.   if(!cgi_state->session || !hdf_obj_child(cgi_state->session))

  6.     return nerr_raise_msg("Empty session");

  7.   if(cgi_state->sessionid) {

  8.     free(cgi_state->sessionid);

  9.     cgi_state->sessionid = NULL;

  10.   }

  11.   if(cgi_state->create_session)

  12.     return (*cgi_state->create_session)(cgi_state);

  13.   <Create session using local files>

  14.   return nerr;

  15. }

<(build.nw) Known Data Types>+= [<-D->]

  1. session_create_cb,%

For files, the session ID is also a unqiue file name, as created by mkstemp in a configurable directory.

<CGI Session Support Configuration>= (U->)

  1. # The default directory where local sessions are stored

  2. # Clearing this parameter disables local file session support

  3. #cgi_session_dir = /var/cache/cgi-sessions

<CGI Session Support Variables>= (<-U)

  1. static const char *session_dir;

<Initialize file-based session support>= (<-U)

  1. session_dir = getconf("cgi_session_dir", "/var/cache/cgi-sessions");

  2. if(!*session_dir)

  3.   session_dir = NULL;

  4. else

  5.   mkdir(session_dir, 0700); /* in case it doesn't exist yet */

<Build session file name>= (U-> U-> U->)

  1. GString *path = g_string_new(session_dir);

  2. if(path->str[path->len - 1] != '/')

  3.   g_string_append_c(path, '/');

  4. g_string_append(path, cgi_state->sessionid);

New ticket IDs include the current date, masked to 32 bits. This guarantees that there will never be a repeated ticket, as long as the expiration time is longer than a few seconds, and no session lasts longer than 68 years. It is not necessary to lock the file from concurrent access, as the newly created file's name is not known to anyone but the creation function.

<Create session using local files>= (<-U)

  1. if(!session_dir)

  2.   return STATUS_OK;

  3. cgi_state->sessionid = (char *)"CS";

  4. <Build session file name>

  5. cgi_state->sessionid = NULL;

  6. time(&now);

  7. g_string_append_printf(path, "%08XXXXXXX", (int)now);

  8. int fd = mkstemp(path->str);

  9. if(fd < 0) {

  10.   g_string_free(path, TRUE);

  11.   return nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "Cannot create session state in %s",

  12.                                    session_dir);

  13. }

  14. cgi_state->sessionid = strdup(strrchr(path->str, '/') + 1);

  15. if(!cgi_state->sessionid) {

  16.   close(fd);

  17.   unlink(path->str);

  18.   g_string_free(path, TRUE);

  19.   return nerr_raise_errno(NERR_NOMEM, "cannot create session id");

  20. }

  21. <Write session file>

  22. close(fd);

  23. if(nerr != STATUS_OK) {

  24.   free(cgi_state->sessionid);

  25.   cgi_state->sessionid = NULL;

  26. }

  27. g_string_free(path, TRUE);

The format of the session file is the standard HDF format. Writing the session file is harder than just hdf_write_file, because the session file is already open, and there is no direct access to hdf_dump_format, which takes an open file as a parameter. Writing to a memory string is the only simple alternative, so memory will be wasted for this operation.

<Write session file>= (<-U U->)

  1. char *s;

  2. nerr = hdf_write_string(cgi_state->session, &s);

  3. if(nerr == STATUS_OK) {

  4.   if(debug) {

  5.     cgi_puts("<pre>Write session:\n");

  6.     cgi_puts_html_escape(cgi_state, s, FALSE);

  7.     cgi_puts("--------\n</pre>\n");

  8.   }

  9.   int n, todo = strlen(s), off = 0;

  10.   while(todo) {

  11.     n = write(fd, s + off, todo);

  12.     if(n < 0 && errno != EAGAIN && errno != EINTR) {

  13.       nerr = nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "writing session");

  14.       unlink(path->str);

  15.       break;

  16.     }

  17.     if(n > 0) {

  18.       off += n;

  19.       todo -= n;

  20.     }

  21.   }

  22.   free(s);

  23. }

Reading the session state should be an incremental operation. That way, a large amount of state can be stored, but only the needed state is passed around in the state structure. All elements under the passed-in root are destroyed. If there is no persistent state under the desired root, the root node itself will be created anyway. In order to make it easier to read in a particular part of the state based on a CGI parameter, the name is specified in two parts. Either part may be NULL. If both are non-NULL, the second is a child of the first.

<CGI State Dependencies>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. typedef NEOERR *(*session_read_cb)(const char *name, const char *child,

  2.                                    HDF *target, gboolean recursive,

  3.                                    cgi_state_t *cgi_state);

<CGI State Members>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. session_read_cb read_session;

<CGI Session Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. NEOERR *read_session_state(const char *root_name, const char *child_name,

  2.                            gboolean recursive, cgi_state_t *cgi_state)

  3. {

  4.   NEOERR *nerr;

  5.   HDF *root, *child;

  6.   if(!cgi_state->sessionid)

  7.     return nerr_raise(NERR_PARSE, "No session ID");

  8.   if(child_name && !*child_name)

  9.     child_name = NULL;

  10.   if(!root_name || !*root_name) {

  11.     root_name = child_name;

  12.     child_name = NULL;

  13.   }

  14.   if(root_name && !*root_name)

  15.     root_name = NULL;

  16.   if(!root_name) {

  17.     if(cgi_state->session)

  18.       hdf_destroy(&cgi_state->session);

  19.     if((nerr = hdf_init(&cgi_state->session)))

  20.       return nerr;

  21.     root = cgi_state->session;

  22.   } else {

  23.     if(!cgi_state->session && (nerr = hdf_init(&cgi_state->session)))

  24.       return nerr;

  25.     if((nerr = hdf_get_node(cgi_state->session, root_name, &root)))

  26.       return nerr;

  27.     if(child_name &&

  28.        (nerr = hdf_get_node(root, child_name, &root)))

  29.       return nerr;

  30.     while((child = hdf_obj_child(root)))

  31.       hdf_remove_tree(root, hdf_obj_name(child));

  32.   }

  33.   if(cgi_state->read_session)

  34.     return (*cgi_state->read_session)(root_name, child_name, root, recursive,

  35.                                       cgi_state);

  36.   <Read session from local files>

  37.   return nerr;

  38. }

<(build.nw) Known Data Types>+= [<-D->]

  1. session_read_cb,%

However, reading just part of a full HDF file is not that simple. Instead, the entire file is read in, and the selected node is copied to the persistent state. Unlike with creation, no assumption can be made about simultaneous access. For this reason, the file is locked during the read. Also, in order to support expiring old sessions, the state files are touched at every access. This allows an external daemon to be used to flush out sessions with old modification times. Access times are often disabled in modern systems, so that is not sufficient.

<(build.nw) Common C Includes>+= [<-D->]

  1. #include <utime.h>

<Read session from local files>= (<-U)

  1. int fd;

  2. HDF *hdf;

  3. if(!session_dir)

  4.   return STATUS_OK;

  5. if((nerr = hdf_init(&hdf)))

  6.   return nerr;

  7. <Build session file name>

  8. utime(path->str, NULL);

  9. <Open and lock session file>

  10. g_string_free(path, TRUE);

  11. if(nerr != STATUS_OK) {

  12.   hdf_destroy(&hdf);

  13.   return nerr;

  14. }

  15. <Read session file into hdf>

  16. close(fd);

  17. if(nerr == STATUS_OK) {

  18.   if(!root_name)

  19.     cgi_state->session = root = hdf;

  20.   else {

  21.     child = hdf_get_obj(hdf, root_name);

  22.     if(child && child_name)

  23.       child = hdf_get_obj(child, child_name);

  24.     if(child)

  25.       nerr = hdf_copy(root, "", child);

  26.     hdf_destroy(&hdf);

  27.   }

  28.   if(!recursive) {

  29.     root = hdf_obj_child(root);

  30.     while(root) {

  31.       while((child = hdf_obj_child(root)))

  32.         hdf_remove_tree(root, hdf_obj_name(child));

  33.       root = hdf_obj_next(root);

  34.     }

  35.   }

  36. }

The locks are done using advisory locks (lockf(3)). This means that even when locking others out isn't necessary, a lock must be obtained to obey others' locks on the file. Since these are write locks, the file is always opened in read-write mode.

<(build.nw) Common C Includes>+= [<-D->]

  1. #include <sys/stat.h>

  2. #include <fcntl.h>

<Open and lock session file>= (<-U U->)

  1. fd = open(path->str, O_RDWR);

  2. if(fd < 0)

  3.   nerr = nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "opening session file %s", path->str);

  4. else {

  5.   while(lockf(fd, F_LOCK, 0)) {

  6.     if(errno == EINTR || errno == EAGAIN)

  7.       continue;

  8.     close(fd);

  9.     nerr = nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "locking session");

  10.     break;

  11.   }

  12. }

Once again, the file is already open, so reading the session is harder than just hdf_read_file. In this case the underlying function is not much different in that the entire file is sucked into memory before processing.

<Read session file into hdf>= (<-U U->)

  1. GString *fcont = g_string_sized_new(64);

  2. int off = 0;

  3. while(nerr == STATUS_OK) {

  4.   int l = read(fd, fcont->str + off, fcont->allocated_len - off);

  5.   if(l > 0) {

  6.     off += l;

  7.     if(off == fcont->allocated_len)

  8.       g_string_set_size(fcont, fcont->allocated_len * 2);

  9.     continue;

  10.   } else if(!l)

  11.     break;

  12.   else if(errno != EAGAIN && errno != EINTR)

  13.     nerr = nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "reading session");

  14. }

  15. fcont->str[off] = 0;

  16. if(debug) {

  17.   cgi_puts("<pre>Read session:\n");

  18.   cgi_puts_html_escape(cgi_state, fcont->str, FALSE);

  19.   cgi_puts("--------\n</pre>\n");

  20. }

  21. if(nerr == STATUS_OK)

  22.   nerr = hdf_read_string(hdf, fcont->str);

  23. g_string_free(fcont, TRUE);

Finally, updating is potentially the most complex method. Updates do not write the entire state information out, especially since no flags are provided to indicate how much of the state has been read. Instead, the root of the state to update is provided. It is up to the caller to ensure that the result is stored in the in-memory session, if necessary. If the provided root is empty, the associated named root is cleared, both in the persistent storage and in the in-memory session. If the named root is blank or NULL, the entire session is destroyed.

It may also be necessary to generate a unique ID while updating the session data. In other words, rather than replacing a key, it may be necessary to append a new child to the key. Rather than requiring external locking and making the user do it, a pointer may be passed in which will be filled in with a node whose name is unique under the root, and under which the passed-in values are stored rather than the root itself. When deleting, the unique root parameter may point to a node which names a child of root_name to be be deleted instead of root_name.

<CGI State Dependencies>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. typedef NEOERR *(*session_update_cb)(const char *root_name, HDF *root,

  2.                                      HDF **unique_root, cgi_state_t *cgi_state);

<CGI State Members>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. session_update_cb update_session;

<CGI Session Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. NEOERR *update_session_state(const char *root_name, HDF *root,

  2.                              HDF **unique_root, cgi_state_t *cgi_state)

  3. {

  4.   NEOERR *nerr = STATUS_OK;

  5.   if(!cgi_state->sessionid)

  6.     return nerr_raise(NERR_PARSE, "No session ID");

  7.   if(root && !hdf_obj_child(root) && !hdf_obj_value(root))

  8.     root = NULL;

  9.   if(root_name && !*root_name)

  10.     root_name = NULL;

  11.   if(unique_root && !root && !*unique_root)

  12.     return nerr_raise(NERR_PARSE, "Cannot create unique key while deleting");

  13.   if(unique_root && !root_name)

  14.     return nerr_raise(NERR_PARSE, "Cannot create unique key under root");

  15.   if(!root) {

  16.     if(!root_name)

  17.       hdf_destroy(&cgi_state->session);

  18.     else if(!unique_root)

  19.       hdf_remove_tree(cgi_state->session, root_name);

  20.     else {

  21.       HDF *child = hdf_get_obj(cgi_state->session, root_name);

  22.       if(child)

  23.         hdf_remove_tree(child, hdf_obj_name(*unique_root));

  24.     }

  25.   }

  26.   if(cgi_state->update_session)

  27.     return (*cgi_state->update_session)(root_name, root, unique_root, cgi_state);

  28.   <Update session using local files>

  29.   return nerr;

  30. }

<(build.nw) Known Data Types>+= [<-D->]

  1. session_update_cb,%

To update the state file, the entire file must be read into memory while locked, and after updating the requested information, it must be written back before unlocking.

<Update session using local files>= (<-U)

  1. if(!session_dir)

  2.   return STATUS_OK;

  3. <Build session file name>

  4. if(!root_name && !root)

  5.   unlink(path->str);

  6. else {

  7.   int fd;

  8.   HDF *hdf;

  9.   if(root_name && (nerr = hdf_init(&hdf))) {

  10.     g_string_free(path, TRUE);

  11.     return nerr;

  12.   }

  13.   <Open and lock session file>

  14.   if(nerr != STATUS_OK) {

  15.     if(root_name)

  16.       hdf_destroy(&hdf);

  17.     g_string_free(path, TRUE);

  18.     return nerr;

  19.   }

  20.   if(root_name) {

  21.     <Read session file into hdf>

  22.     if(lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_SET) < 0)

  23.       ;  /* there is no reason this should fail */

  24.   }

  25.   if(nerr == STATUS_OK) {

  26.     if(!unique_root) {

  27.       if(root_name) {

  28.         hdf_remove_tree(hdf, root_name);

  29.         if(root)

  30.           nerr = hdf_copy(hdf, root_name, root);

  31.         if(hdf_obj_value(root))

  32.           nerr_op(hdf_set_value(hdf, root_name, hdf_obj_value(root)));

  33.       } else

  34.         hdf = root;

  35.     } else if(!root) {

  36.       HDF *child = hdf_get_obj(hdf, root_name);

  37.       if(child)

  38.         hdf_remove_tree(child, hdf_obj_name(*unique_root));

  39.     } else {

  40.       char nbuf[11];

  41.       HDF *child, *parent;

  42.       int i = 0, j;

  43.       nerr = hdf_get_node(hdf, root_name, &parent);

  44.       if(nerr == STATUS_OK) {

  45.         for(child = hdf_obj_child(parent); child; child = hdf_obj_next(child)) {

  46.           j = atoi(hdf_obj_name(child));

  47.           if(j >= i)

  48.             i = j + 1;

  49.         }

  50.         sprintf(nbuf, "%d", i);

  51.         nerr = hdf_get_node(parent, nbuf, unique_root);

  52.         nerr_op(hdf_copy(*unique_root, "", root));

  53.         if(hdf_obj_value(root))

  54.           nerr_op(hdf_set_value(parent, nbuf, hdf_obj_value(root)));

  55.       }

  56.     }

  57.   }

  58.   if(nerr == STATUS_OK) {

  59.     if(ftruncate(fd, 0))

  60.         ; /* ignore return value */

  61.     HDF *olds = cgi_state->session;

  62.     cgi_state->session = hdf;

  63.     <Write session file>

  64.     cgi_state->session = olds;

  65.   }

  66.   close(fd);

  67.   hdf_destroy(&hdf);

  68.   if(nerr != STATUS_OK) /* prevent corrupt sessions */

  69.     unlink(path->str);

  70.   g_string_free(path, TRUE);

  71. }

In this simple session file scheme, session expiration is performed by a separate program. This program examines all files in the session directory, and deletes any older than a specified age. It can be called just once, and remain alive forever, or it can be called from cron on a regular basis; calling it from cron may incur significant overhead. It just uses ftw to look for old files. Since the ftw callback takes no user data, the expiration time is kept in a static variable.

Another option would be to run this in addition to the CGI threads in the main program. That approach has several advantages. There is no need to rememmber to start up a separate process. Sessions will not linger unintentionally, causing potential security issues. On the other hand, if the CGI is run with normal CGI rather than FastCGI, the directory scan will have to be done on every invocation. It is also so simple that it is unlikely to ever crash, so starting it up at system initialization is something that only needs to be remembered once. For added security, it can be added to inittab for the unlikely event of a crash.

<(build.nw) C Executables>= [D->]

  1. delete_old_files \

<delete_old_files.c>=

  1. <(build.nw) Common C Header>

  2. #include <ftw.h>

  3. void help(void)

  4. {

  5.   fputs("Delete old state files\n"

  6.         "Usage: delete_old_files <dir> <exp_time sec> [<next check sec>]\n"

  7.         "If <next check sec> is given, sleep that amount and check again\n"

  8.         "forever.  If <next check sec> is 0, use <exp time sec> / 2.\n",

  9.         stderr);

  10.   exit(1);

  11. }

  12. static time_t exp_time;

  13. int delete_old_files(const char *fpath, const struct stat *sb, int typeflag)

  14. {

  15.   if(typeflag == FTW_F && sb->st_mtime < exp_time)

  16.     unlink(fpath);

  17.   return 0;

  18. }

  19. int main(int argc, const char **argv)

  20. {

  21.   int next, exps;

  22.   if(argc < 3 || argc > 4)

  23.     help();

  24.   if(chdir(argv[1])) {

  25.     perror(argv[1]);

  26.     help();

  27.   }

  28.   exps = atoi(argv[2]);

  29.   if(exps <= 0)

  30.     help();

  31.   if(argc > 3) {

  32.     next = atoi(argv[3]);

  33.     if(next <= 0)

  34.       next = exps / 2;

  35.   } else

  36.     next = 0;

  37.   time(&exp_time);

  38.   exp_time -= exps;

  39.   if(next)

  40.     while(1) {

  41.       ftw(".", delete_old_files, 2);

  42.       sleep(next);

  43.       time(&exp_time);

  44.        exp_time -= exps;

  45.     }

  46.   else

  47.     ftw(".", delete_old_files, 2);

  48.   return 0;

  49. }

Although finding an active session's ID is not likely, the session must still be keyed to the client. The client can never be completely reliably identified, but a few attributes tend to be fairly stable:

  • REMOTE_ADDR (CGI.RemoteAddress) --- This is only unstable if the user switches between a caching proxy and direct access, or is behind a firewall that masks this. For security, these cases will be ignored and this parameter is always used.
  • HTTP_USER_AGENT (HTTP.UserAgent) --- Again, this is unstable if the user switches between a caching proxy and direct access, but the proxy should use the same user agent anyway to ensure that the correct compatibility flags are set on remote applications. Again, this parameter will always be used.
  • REMOTE_USER (CGI.RemoteUser) --- Users may log on, or not. The session should definitely terminate if the user ID changes.
  • An arbitrary CGI parameter or cookie passed around with the session ID --- the previous parameters prevent the cookie from being passed around to other people for authentication. However, if the REMOTE_USER parameter is not set by the web server on every access, it should be passed around with the session ID.

These parameters are saved in the state with the same base name, but Session as the parent.

<Get Session Invariants>= (U->)

  1. const char *remote_addr, *user_agent, *remote_user;

  2. remote_addr = cgi_env_val("CGI.RemoteAddress", "127.0.0.1");

  3. user_agent = cgi_header_val("UserAgent", "telnet");

  4. remote_user = cgi_state->userid ? cgi_state->userid : "";

<CGI Support Global Definitions>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. #define cgi_session_val(n, d) hdf_get_value(cgi_state->session, n, d)

  2. #define cgi_session_val_int(n, d) hdf_get_int64_value(cgi_state->session, n, d)

  3. #define cgi_session_obj(n) hdf_get_obj(cgi_state->session, n)

  4. #define cgi_session_set(n, v) hdf_set_value(cgi_state->session, n, v)

  5. #define cgi_session_set_int(n, v) hdf_set_int64_value(cgi_state->session, n, v)

<(build.nw) C Prototypes>+= [<-D->]

  1. const char *cgi_session_val(const char *name, const char *def_val);

  2. gint64 cgi_session_val_int(const char *name, gint64 def_val);

  3. HDF *cgi_session_obj(const char *name);

  4. NEOERR *cgi_session_set(const char *name, const char *value);

  5. NEOERR *cgi_session_set_int(const char *name, gint64 value);

<CGI Session Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. NEOERR *set_session_validation(cgi_state_t *cgi_state)

  2. {

  3.   <Get Session Invariants>

  4.   NEOERR *nerr = STATUS_OK;

  5.   if(!cgi_state->session)

  6.     nerr = hdf_init(&cgi_state->session);

  7.   if(nerr == STATUS_OK)

  8.     nerr = cgi_session_set("Session.RemoteAddress", remote_addr);

  9.   if(nerr == STATUS_OK)

  10.     nerr = cgi_session_set("Session.UserAgent", user_agent);

  11.   if(nerr == STATUS_OK)

  12.     nerr = cgi_session_set("Session.RemoteUser", remote_user);

  13.   return nerr;

  14. }

  15. gboolean validate_session(cgi_state_t *cgi_state)

  16. {

  17.   if(!cgi_state->session)

  18.     return FALSE;

  19.   <Get Session Invariants>

  20.   return

  21.     !strcmp(cgi_session_val("Session.RemoteAddress", ""),

  22.             remote_addr) &&

  23.     !strcmp(cgi_session_val("Session.UserAgent", ""),

  24.             user_agent) &&

  25.     !strcmp(cgi_session_val("Session.RemoteUser", ""),

  26.             remote_user);

  27. }

Integration of the session into a CGI program requires use of either CGI parameters or cookies. Some people turn cookies off in the browser, so the best approach is to use both, and remove the CGI parameters if the cookies appear to be working. An additional CGI parameter is set to indicate that cookies should no longer be tried. The parameter names begin with a short prefix to avoid sending long names around all the time (ses.). The session ID is sent as id and the user ID is sent as un. The no-cookie flag is nc.

<CGI Session Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. NEOERR *print_session_cgi_parms(cgi_state_t *cgi_state, gboolean force)

  2. {

  3.   NEOERR *nerr;

  4.   if(!cgi_state->sessionid)

  5.     return STATUS_OK;

  6.   if(!force && cgi_cookie_val("ses.id", NULL))

  7.     return STATUS_OK;

  8.   if(!cgi_puts("<input type=\"hidden\" name=\"ses.id\" value=\""))

  9.     return nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "cgi write");

  10.   if((nerr = cgi_puts_html_escape(cgi_state, cgi_state->sessionid, FALSE)))

  11.     return nerr;

  12.   if(!cgi_puts("\">\n"))

  13.     return nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "cgi write");

  14.   if(cgi_state->userid && !cgi_getenv("REMOTE_USER")) {

  15.     if(!cgi_puts("<input type=\"hidden\" name=\"ses.un\" value=\""))

  16.       return nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "cgi write");

  17.     if((nerr = cgi_puts_html_escape(cgi_state, cgi_state->userid, FALSE)))

  18.       return nerr;

  19.     if(!cgi_puts("\">\n"))

  20.       return nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "cgi write");

  21.   }

  22.   if(!force && cgi_parm_val("ses.id", NULL)) /* 2nd go around */

  23.     if(!cgi_puts("<input type=\"hidden\" name=\"ses.nc\" value=\"y\">\n"))

  24.       return nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "cgi write");

  25.   return STATUS_OK;

  26. }

<CGI Session Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. void g_string_append_session_cgi_parms(cgi_state_t *cgi_state, gboolean first,

  2.                                        GString *buf, gboolean force)

  3. {

  4.   if(!cgi_state->sessionid)

  5.     return;

  6.   if(!force && cgi_cookie_val("ses.id", NULL))

  7.     return;

  8.   if(first)

  9.     g_string_append_c(buf, '?');

  10.   else

  11.     g_string_append_c(buf, '&');

  12.   g_string_append(buf, "ses.id=");

  13.   g_string_append_uri_escaped(buf, cgi_state->sessionid, NULL, FALSE);

  14.   if(cgi_state->userid && !cgi_getenv("REMOTE_USER")) {

  15.     g_string_append(buf, "&ses.un=");

  16.     g_string_append_uri_escaped(buf, cgi_state->userid, NULL, FALSE);

  17.   }

  18.   if(!force && cgi_parm_val("ses.id", NULL)) /* 2nd go around */

  19.     g_string_append(buf, "&ses.nc=y");

  20. }

<CGI Session Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. NEOERR *print_session_cookie(cgi_state_t *cgi_state, gboolean force)

  2. {

  3.   NEOERR *nerr = STATUS_OK;

  4.   const char *s;

  5.   if(!cgi_state->sessionid)

  6.     return STATUS_OK;

  7.   s = cgi_cookie_val("ses.id", NULL);

  8.   if(!s && !force && cgi_parm_val("ses.nc", NULL))

  9.     return STATUS_OK;

  10.   if(!s || strcmp(s, cgi_state->sessionid)) {

  11.     if(cgi_printf("Set-Cookie: ses.id=%s; path=/\n", cgi_state->sessionid) < 1)

  12.       nerr = nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "CGI Write");

  13.   }

  14.   if(nerr == STATUS_OK && cgi_state->userid && !cgi_getenv("REMOTE_USER")) {

  15.     s = cgi_cookie_val("ses.un", NULL);

  16.     if(!s || strcmp(s, cgi_state->userid)) {

  17.       if(cgi_printf("Set-Cookie: ses.un=%s; path=/\n", cgi_state->userid) < 1)

  18.         nerr = nerr_raise_errno(NERR_IO, "CGI Write");

  19.     }

  20.   }

  21.   return nerr;

  22. }

Supporting the same things in templates is a bit tricker. If a template is to print the cookie, the easiest way to convey that is to set a variable. Likewise, a variable is set to request dumping the form variables. Rather than setting the variable to the text to be printed, ClearSilver macros are provided to dump the variable's hierarchy in the appropriate format. This makes adding more session variables easier, and simplifies the memory managment in the C code.

<CGI Session Support Functions>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. NEOERR *set_session_tmpl_vars(cgi_state_t *cgi_state, gboolean force_cookie,

  2.                               gboolean force_form)

  3. {

  4.   NEOERR *nerr = STATUS_OK;

  5.   if(!cgi_state->sessionid)

  6.     return STATUS_OK;

  7.   if(force_form || !cgi_cookie_val("ses.id", NULL)) {

  8.     nerr_op(cgi_env_set("CGI.SessionParms.ses.id", cgi_state->sessionid));

  9.     if(cgi_state->userid && !cgi_getenv("REMOTE_USER"))

  10.       nerr_op(cgi_env_set("CGI.SessionParms.ses.un", cgi_state->userid));

  11.     if(!force_form && cgi_parm_val("ses.id", NULL)) /* 2nd go around */

  12.       nerr_op(cgi_env_set("CGI.SessionParms.ses.nc", "y"));

  13.   }

  14.   const char *s = cgi_cookie_val("ses.id", NULL);

  15.   if(!s && !force_cookie && cgi_parm_val("ses.nc", NULL))

  16.     return nerr;

  17.   if(!s || strcmp(s, cgi_state->sessionid))

  18.     nerr_op(cgi_env_set("CGI.SessionCookies.ses.id", cgi_state->sessionid));

  19.   if(cgi_state->userid && !cgi_getenv("REMOTE_USER"))

  20.     nerr_op(cgi_env_set("CGI.SessionCookies.ses.un", cgi_state->userid));

  21.   return nerr;

  22. }

<Generic ClearSilver HTML Macros>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. def:print_session_cookie(prefix, cookie) ?><?cs

  2.   if:subcount(cookie) > 0 ?><?cs

  3.    each:c = cookie ?><?cs

  4.       call:print_session_cookie(prefix + name(cookie) + ".", c) ?><?cs

  5.    /each ?><?cs

  6.  else

  7.    ?>Set-Coookie: <?cs var:prefix + name(cookie) ?>=<?cs var:cookie ?>; path=/

  8. <?cs

  9.  /if ?><?cs

  10. /def

  11. ?><?cs

  12. def:print_session_cookies() ?><?cs

  13.   each:parm = CGI.SessionCookies ?><?cs

  14.     call:print_session_cookie("", parm) ?><?cs

  15.   /each ?><?cs

  16. /def ?><?cs

<Generic ClearSilver HTML Macros>+= (<-U) [<-D->]

  1. def:print_session_parm(prefix, parm) ?><?cs

  2.   if:subcount(parm) > 0 ?><?cs

  3.    each:c = parm ?><?cs

  4.       call:print_session_parm(prefix + name(parm) + ".", c) ?><?cs

  5.    /each ?><?cs

  6.  else

  7.    ?><input type="hidden" name="<?cs var:prefix + name(parm)

  8.             ?> value="<?cs var:parm ?>">

  9. <?cs

  10.  /if ?><?cs

  11. /def

  12. ?><?cs

  13. def:print_session_parms() ?><?cs

  14.   each:parm = CGI.SessionParms ?><?cs

  15.     call:print_session_parm("", parm) ?><?cs

  16.   /each ?><?cs

  17. /def ?><?cs

<Generic ClearSilver HTML Macros>+= (<-U) [<-D]

  1. def:add_session_parm(prefix, parm, first) ?><?cs

  2.   if:subcount(parm) > 0 ?><?cs

  3.    each:c = parm ?><?cs

  4.       call:add_session_parm(prefix + name(parm) + ".", c, first) ?><?cs

  5.       set:first = 0 ?><?cs

  6.    /each ?><?cs

  7.  else

  8.    ?><?cs if:first ?>?<?cs else ?>&<?cs /if ?><?cs

  9.       var:url_escape(prefix + name(parm)) ?>=<?cs var:url_escape(parm) ?><?cs

  10.       set:first = 0 ?><?cs

  11.  /if ?><?cs

  12. /def

  13. ?><?cs

  14. def:add_session_parms(first) ?><?cs
